L2_gloss:
A clitic added to the plural forms of nouns that are identical to the singular forms in order to mark plurality explicitly.
Added to the plural forms of some nouns that do have distinct plural forms in order to express that various individuals are meant.
A kind of electric catfish, in the genus Malapterurus.
A kind of elephantfish, in the genus Mormyrops.
Used to link a possessed noun to its possessor.
tilapia (any fish in the genus Tilapia)
A fish in the genus Citharinus.
A kind of climbing gourami, in the genus Ctenopoma.
A kind of catfish, in the family Schilbeidae.
A brightly spotted species of upside-down catfish, Synodontis angelicus.
A species of catfish, Amphilius maesii.
A species of catfish, Chrysichthys cranchii.
A species of carp, Labeo longipinnis.
A kind of snakehead, in the genus Parachanna.
A kind of eel-like fish, Mastacembelus.
A kind of bichir, in the genus Polypterus, prized as a delicacy by the Nzadi.
The tigerfish, in the genus Hydrocynus.
A small, thin fish in the genus Belonophago.
A kind of barb (cyprinid fish), in the genus Varicorhinus.
A kind of pufferfish, in the genus Tetraodon, which is poisonous and not eaten by the Nzadi.
Added to the personal pronouns to form reflexive pronouns.
A large catfish, perhaps of the genus Clarias.
head pad (pad used to carry a load on one's head)
A fish in the genus Distichodus.
A kind of carp, in the genus Labeo.
